channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report E-2024080768
item.description:
Report E-2024080768

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-04T09:14:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-24
  • City: HUBER HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately ten (10) ounces of material released from two (2) 1-quart metal cans due to crushed freight due to improper preparation for transit that impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area and containerized the cleanup debris into one (1) 5-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080772
item.description:
Report E-2024080772

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-04T09:14:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-23
  • City: NORTH RIDGEVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately 1.5 gallons of material released from two (2) 1-gallon metal pails. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and containerized the spent absorbents and damaged pails into one (1) 5-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080751
item.description:
Report E-2024080751

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-02T09:14:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-06
  • City: WEST CHESTER
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately ten (10) ounces of material released impacting the trailer floor from one (1) 1-gallon metal pail due to a forklift puncture. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 30-gallon poly drum along with impacted cardboard and the damaged pail. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080662
item.description:
Report E-2024080662

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-25
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: HEPACO was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 4ft-by-10ft area of the trailer floor and a 5ft-by-20ft area of concrete underneath the trailer and estimated that ten (10) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) drum. HEPACO personnel overpacked the damaged drum into one (1) 95-gallon poly drum and neutralized the impacted area. The recovered material was placed into two (2) 55-gallon poly drums for disposal.
